meanings.definition: To have a harsh, discordant sound
meanings.sent1: The loud crash of the cymbals was jarring to my ears.
meanings.sent2: The screeching brakes on the train were jarring to the passengers.
meanings.sent3: The jarring noise of the alarm clock woke me up with a start.
meanings.sent4: The jarring clash of opinions in the meeting made it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The jarring sound of the thunder shook the windows of the house.

meanings.definition: To have a strong, unpleasant effect
meanings.sent1: The bad news was jarring to her fragile emotions.
meanings.sent2: The bitter cold wind was jarring against my exposed skin.
meanings.sent3: The jarring taste of the medicine made him cringe.
meanings.sent4: The sudden loss had a jarring impact on the family.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected turn of events was jarring to everyone involved.

meanings.sent1: The earthquake jarring the ground beneath us was terrifying.
meanings.sent2: The strong gust of wind jarring the tree branches sounded ominous.
meanings.sent3: The jarring motion of the roller coaster made her scream with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The sudden news jarring his routine left him feeling disoriented.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected phone call jarring her from her thoughts startled her.
